com.google.api.services.samples.shared.cmdline.oauth2

Class OAuth2Native

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.api.services.samples.shared.cmdline.oauth2.OAuth2Native

  • public class OAuth2Native
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements OAuth authentication "native" flow recommended for installed clients in which the end user must grant access in a web browser and then copy a code into the application.

    The client_secrets.json file contains your client application's client ID and client secret. They can be found in the Google APIs Console. If this is your first time, click "Create project...". Then, activate the Google APIs your client application uses and agree to the terms of service. Now, click on "API Access", and then on "Create an OAuth 2.0 Client ID...". Enter a product name and click "Next". >Select "Installed application" and click "Create client ID". Finally, enter the "Client ID" and "Client secret" shown under "Client ID for installed applications" into src/main/resources/client_secrets.json.

    Warning: the client ID and secret are not secured and are plainly visible to users of your application. It is a hard problem to secure client credentials in installed applications.

    In this sample code, it attempts to open the browser using Desktop.isDesktopSupported(). If that fails, on Windows it tries rundll32. If that fails, it opens the browser specified in BROWSER, though note that currently we've only tested this code with Google Chrome (hence this is the default value).

    Author:
    Yaniv Inbar
